intro: Campylospermum gabonense subsp. australe, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a woody shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, nocturnal-opening white flowers. The plant has opposite, elliptical leaves that are often hairy on the underside. It produces small, spherical berries that turn red when mature. This species is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats.
